posts.name: bigheaded

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
interesting that both the cloudflare maintenance and the AWS outage started at the same time (07:00 UTC).

cloudflarestatus.com

Cloudflare Status

Welcome to Cloudflare's home for real-time and historical data on system performance.

https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status
i wonder if somehow one caused the other. maybe just a coincidence.
also seems that the outage on US-east-1 is quite severe, usually when that AZ goes down quite a lot of the internet gets broken.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: So there’s a chance a misconfiguration on Signal’s side is causing this since they aren’t rerouting the traffic.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:

gotosocial.sny.sh – 20 Oct 25

Post by Sunny, @sunny@gotosocial.sny.sh

gotta love how decentralized the internet is!

It’s not planned maintenance, it’s a major AWS outage.

https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

EDIT: It’s crazy how effectively centralised all these services actually are. It feels like they should be a lot more distributed to avoid single-point-of-failures like that.

posts.cooked:
Oooh…. DNS?

(20 chars)

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Nope, seems that Cloudflare told customers to be ready to redirect traffic, but Amazon may have not?

posts.name: Tyl89
posts.cooked: I know this isn’t signals fault but from what I see above it’s an outage in another country why would this affect users in the eu it sounds like all eggs in one basket and only takes one link in the chain to break and it all breaks weird

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: This is how most of the internet works in general. A BGP attack can take out the internet in another country until the country is distrusted. Amazon seems to not have configured their services to roll over properly to other cloudflare nodes would be my guess.

Tyl89:

why would this affect users in the eu

All of Signal’s servers are deployed in that one location.

I am guessing it already costs millions to run the service as it is and they are only just now about breaking even, so running more servers in more locations would be prohibitive cost-wise.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
They aren’t btw.
